title.narrative: F.a: Decent Work in the Value Chain of Grapes

description.narrative:
In the project in cooperation with Kesko is studied the value chain of the Pirkka grapes. The project studies the formation of the share of work in the value creation of the product and realization of the Kesko's decent work principles in countries of orig in, as well as at different levels of the supply chain.
Due to the UN guiding principles on business and human rights, companies are responsible for respecting human rights and they must also avoid their own actions which cause human rights violations or contributing to them. The study explains the key product of retail (grape) value chain dynamics, the working conditions in the key product?s value chain and accountability.
The project allows to strengthen the various trade unions in the supply chain and improve their negotiating position. With the study, Kesko obtain more information on functionality of their supply chain, as well as transparency and SASK is through research able to understand the value creation in the supply chain and Kesko's accountabil ity of sourcing practices from the perspective of the United Nations guiding principles of the business and human rights.
The research project is implemented together with the three research institutes which are close to trade union movement and as well a s Finland's leading attorney who is experienced with international law and especially UN guiding principles.
